answers.answer: Intermittent abdominal discomfort is common after gastric bypass.  Minimally elevated liver function enzymes are not very concerning unless they are persistently and increasingly elevated.  If so, possible reasons can be: hepatitis (viral or drug e.g. acetaminophen (panadol)), common bile duct stones (even after gall bladder removal), or pancreas lesions.  Looking into the reasons for elevation can include more blood tests for viral hepatitis, ultrasound or HIDA scan to look at common bile duct, CT scan to look at pancreas, and a detailed history of medication and supplements.  Some herbs can even elevate liver function enzymes.  A second opinion is a good idea.Enoch Choi,MD

question: I had some abdominal pain under the sternum a few weeks ago that I thought was due to my gastric bypass surgery.
